channel.title: Github on zzamboni
channel.description: Recent content in Github on zzamboni

item.title: Using Multiple SSH Keys with Github
item.description: via http://www.freshblurbs.com/blog/2013/06/22/github-multiple-ssh-keys.html#tldr Since Github doesn't allow us to reuse an SSH Key, the only sane solution is to jump through some hoops and generate + use multiple keys on the server itself. Let's look at some effective approaches of doing that. Short version: define multiple hosts in the SSH config file for each repository, which use different SSH keys, then you can assign different deploy keys to each repo.
